intro: Centropogon ferrugineus var. nitens, commonly known as the rusty false dawnflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a reddish or rusty hue, contributing to its common name. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
